title: Markdown code block sequence makes report unreadable

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Proof of Concept**

Submitting a report/comment with an input like the following

"Three backticks followed by a newline followed by `-d*{d}d/<<d`"

will cause the report to be unreadable (I think it's because the parser is crashing?)

The attached file includes the input that I'm trying (with difficulty) to describe with text, since I can't actually include the crasher in the report.

This may have no security implications; the worst I can imagine doing with this is annoying people by creating reports that can't easily be closed.
vulnerability_information_html:
Proof of Concept

Submitting a report/comment with an input like the following

"Three backticks followed by a newline followed by -d*{d}d/<<d"

will cause the report to be unreadable (I think it's because the parser is crashing?)

The attached file includes the input that I'm trying (with difficulty) to describe with text, since I can't actually include the crasher in the report.

This may have no security implications; the worst I can imagine doing with this is annoying people by creating reports that can't easily be closed.

activities.message: Well, I take back the "creating reports that can't easily be closed" since you can do that via the bulk edit interface.
activities.markdown_message: Well, I take back the "creating reports that can't easily be closed" since you can do that via the bulk edit interface.

activities.message:
Hey @danlec,

I'll look into this. I doubt that this will have any security implications, but it's worth checking out.
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @danlec,

activities.message:
Hey @danlec,

I've tracked down where this issue comes from: It's one of the lexers of Rouge (Specifically the one for the 'Slim' language) failing. 

```plaintext
> Array(Rouge::Lexer.find_fancy('', "```\n-d*{d}d/<<d"))
=> [#<Rouge::Lexers::Slim:0x007fab1742fb20 @debug=nil, @options={}>]

> Rouge::Lexers::Slim.lex("```\n-d*{d}d/<<d").to_a
NoMethodError: undefined method `<<' for nil:NilClass
```

I've reproduced the lexer issue with a simpler attack string (which doesn't have to convince fancy_find that it's Slim) of `-<<x` and created an [issue](https://github.com/jneen/rouge/issues/236) on rouge's github page (I've added you as reference there). 

As this is a very rare scenario, which only usable to make one's own reports unreadable, we've decided that we will not actively pursue this issue. Therefore I'm closing this report as "won't fix".

Thank you for the report, another pretty amazing find!

Cheers, Dirk
activities.markdown_message:

> Rouge::Lexers::Slim.lex("```\n-d*{d}d/<<d").to_a
NoMethodError: undefined method `<<' for nil:NilClass

I've reproduced the lexer issue with a simpler attack string (which doesn't have to convince fancy_find that it's Slim) of -<<x and created an issue on rouge's github page (I've added you as reference there).

As this is a very rare scenario, which only usable to make one's own reports unreadable, we've decided that we will not actively pursue this issue. Therefore I'm closing this report as "won't fix".

Thank you for the report, another pretty amazing find!

Cheers, Dirk

activities.message: Yeah, I expected as much; I just came across that while poking at the markdown and figured I may as well report it.
activities.markdown_message: Yeah, I expected as much; I just came across that while poking at the markdown and figured I may as well report it.

activities.message:
Yeah, and don't get me wrong, we really appreciate the report. 

In other news, the maintainer of Rouge has fixed the issue, and will be releasing a fixed version soon.

Cheers, Dirk

activities.message:
Hey @danlec,

So sorry this took so long, we've been waiting for a release from Rouge to get this updated. The bug was fixed in their repo in feb, but only included in a release last month.

We're now in the process of upgrading rouge, and will have a fix out soon.

Cheers,
Dirk

activities.message:
Seeing as this is a (albeit very limited) DoS bug, we'll be closing this as resolved as soon as the fix is out. Due to the limited scope it will however not be eligible for a bounty

Cheers, Dirk

activities.message: @dirk It does seem kinda inconsistent that #59369 was eligible but this one wasn't :)
activities.markdown_message: @dirk It does seem kinda inconsistent that #59369 was eligible but this one wasn't :)

activities.message:
Hey @danlec,

They are very similar, the difference here is that #59369 also broke the bulk edit interface, which meant that the reports could not be closed and/or removed in any way. This made it a feasible DoS, as you could overwhelm a team with spam reports, without them being able to handle them. I see that this wasn't reflected properly in the messaging around the report, so I just added a summary to it that better reflects the impact of the issue.

Thanks for the feedback!
Dirk
